author: Canadian Press
title: Union representing 40 per cent of Quebec teachers reaches deal, ends unlimited strike
text:
MONTREAL — A union representing 40 per cent of Quebec teachers has reached a deal in principle with the government and is ending a strike that has shut around 800 schools since Nov. 23.
Fédération autonome de l’enseignement — or FAE — said Thursday night on social media that it spent the day analyzing a tentative deal with the province and will recommend it to its members for approval during general assemblies after the holidays. Details of the agreement have not been released.
Even though the FAE called the deal "a new step," it emphasized "it is up to the teachers to respond to (Premier) François Legault's government and to say whether they feel they have been heard."
The union said it has ended all of its pressure tactics, such as the general strike that has shut 800 schools, including in Montreal, since the end of November. If students affected by the FAE strike return to school as scheduled in January, they will have been away from classes for almost seven consecutive weeks.
The FAE, which represents more than 66,000 teachers, took the most hard line out of all the public sector unions negotiating new contracts with the government when it launched an unlimited general strike.
Earlier today, the government announced it had reached tentative deals on salaries with an alliance of unions, excluding the FAE, representing 420,000 public sector employees, including teachers and health-care workers. They had walked out sporadically since November, for a total of 11 days.
The only major labour group without any sort of agreement is a nurses union with about 80,000 members — Fédération interprofessionnelle de la santé du Québec — which said today that negotiations are ongoing.
Earlier Thursday, before the FAE announced the end to its strike, Sylvain Martel, spokesman for parents group Regroupement des comités de parents autonomes du Québec, said he was feeling optimistic but remaining cautious that 800 schools would reopen after the holiday break.
"We're glad that we're able to hope for going back to school on Jan. 9, but everything is tentative, lots of people have to agree to what's on the table, so let's hope that it's a real deal and (union) members will get what they want," he said in an interview.
Martel said discussions have been taking place between teachers, parents and administrators about how children will catch up after missing so much school. How that happens will vary, he said, because the effects of the strikes were unequal — some parents taught their children at home, others hired tutors, but many less-fortunate students spent weeks with little to no learning at all.
"It's very difficult for students to go back to the same rhythm they were in November, so it's going to take a little while, but we'll get there," he said.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published Dec. 28, 2023.
The Canadian Press

author: 新华日报
title: 淮安港-上海港沪苏通班列"天天班"开行
text:
本报讯(陈海霞王琪许又之黄海涛)4月1日，一列满载光伏组件、纺织品等货物的海铁联运班列从淮安新港铁路公司鸣笛启程，16小时后抵达上海港装船出海。这标志着淮安港—上海港沪苏通班列“天天班”正式开行，运行密度由原来的每周4班升至每周7班。
　　自2019年开通集装箱海铁联运班列以来，淮安港稳定开行两条海铁联运班列，目前已服务地方及周边企业近200家，为淮安外贸出口提供坚实支撑。数据显示，淮安港2024年全年累计发送外贸集装箱达2.879万标箱；今年一季度外贸集装箱发送量已突破1万标箱、同比增长100%，刷新历史纪录。下一步，淮安港将以海铁联运为基础，强化与上海港、 宁波港 （ 601018 ）的协同联动，搭建全方位国际物流服务大平台，提升淮安港内河枢纽港核心竞争力，为货品出海再添助力。

author: Shayan Malik
title: Dana White Shuts Down Islam Makhachev's UFC Middleweight Ambitions
text:
Summary
- Makhachev wants to move up to 185 and is eyeing a potential fight against Dricus du Plessis.
- Dana White doubts Makhachev's chances at middleweight, prefers him to move to welterweight.
- White is more open to a superfight between Alex Pereira and du Plessis at middleweight.
The UFC Lightweight Champion Islam Makhachev
has recently been discussing a move to middleweight, though many were expecting welterweight to be the next path in his career.
This caught many fans off-guard, as Makhachev currently fights 30 pounds below middleweight, and now the UFC President Dana White has commented on a potential weight change.
Related
Islam Makhachev: Age, Height, Wife, Record & More
Discover key details about UFC lightweight champion Islam Makhachev, including his age, height, wife, fight record, and more.
Islam Makhachev Believes He Can Take On Dricus du Plessis
The Lightweight Champion Wants To Move From 155 To 185
In an interview with Ushatayka, Makhachev discussed two major things, the first being who he wants as his next opponent, and the other having to do with a superfight against UFC Middleweight Champion Dricus du Plessis.
Islam believes that he has the size and the frame to move to middleweight without it being a problem, and specifically mentioned his height. He also stated that he has the keys to victory if he were to fight du Plessis.
DDP responded to this claim during an interview with MainEventTV, calling the fight an easy payday if it were to ever happen. He explained how although Makhachev is big for the lightweight division, he considers himself big for the middleweight division.
Related
How Islam Makhachev is On the Path to Becoming the Greatest UFC Fighter Ever
UFC Lightweight Champion Islam Makhachev has taken over the MMA world by storm, all while slowly moving up in the greatest fighter rankings.
Dana White Responds To Makhachev's Middleweight Aspirations
The UFC President Is Not A Fan Of Islam's Idea Of Fighting Two Weight Classes Up
UFC President Dana White commented on Makhachev potentially moving up to middleweight at the Power Slap 11 Press Conference, essentially stating that it won't happen. White is open to Islam moving up to welterweight, though the champion will not do so as he is good friends with the current UFC Welterweight Champion, Belal Muhammad.
When it came to a move regarding the 185 pound division, Dana explained how it was a different level, visibly expressing doubt about Islam's chances. He did not outright deny the idea, though it currently seems very unlikely.
There have been talks about a potential superfight between UFC Light Heavyweight Champion Alex Pereira coming back down to middleweight and challenging Dricus, and given the smaller weight difference, White was much more open to that idea.
Related
How Islam Makhachev Made Company History At UFC 311
At UFC 311, Islam Makhachev became the lightweight GOAT with most UFC Lightweight Championship wins and defenses.

author: archyde
title: Exceptional discovery of a perfectly preserved dinosaur embryo in a fossilized egg
text:
2023-12-28 20:24:00
According to the scientific journal IScience, the embryo belongs to a group of feathered theropods called oviraptorosaurs and measures about 27 centimeters long and offers a fascinating insight into the evolutionary links between dinosaurs and modern birds.
Nicknamed “Baby Yingliang,” this dinosaur embryo is one of the most complete ever discovered, providing researchers with a rare opportunity to observe a baby theropod in an unusual posture, similar to that of today’s bird embryos shortly before the hatching. The posture, called “tucking,” involves hunching the body and lowering the head under the wing, a vital behavior for modern birds during hatching.
Belgian researchers identify the true cause of the extinction of dinosaurs: “One element played a dominant role”
The scientists, including independent writer Ben Taub, published their findings in a paper in 2021, pointing out that the posture observed in Baby Yingliang is unprecedented in non-avian dinosaurs but reminiscent of that of contemporary bird embryos. This similarity suggests that folding behavior may have evolved among the theropod ancestors of birds.
Professor Steve Brusatte, author of the study, commented on this exceptional discovery by pointing out that the prenatal dinosaur resembles a baby bird rolled up in its egg. This observation reinforces the idea that many characteristics of modern birds evolved from their dinosaur ancestors.
Although this discovery is extraordinary, the researchers note that it is currently the only specimen of its type. Therefore, in-depth studies on other similar fossils will be necessary to confirm the hypotheses formulated from Baby Yingliang. Nonetheless, preliminary findings suggest that some developmental behaviors considered exclusively avian may be more deeply rooted in the theropod lineage. A breakthrough that sheds new light on the fascinating evolution of feathered and toothless species that populated the Earth millions of years ago.
1703804739
#Exceptional #discovery #perfectly #preserved #dinosaur #embryo #fossilized #egg
